org.swisscheese.swisscheese.map.maze

Enum CellGrid.Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<CellGrid.Direction>
      • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.map.maze.CellGrid.Direction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CellGrid.Direction>
    Enclosing class:
    CellGrid

    public static enum CellGrid.Direction
extends java.lang.Enum<CellGrid.Direction>
    The ENUM for each cardinal direction: NORTH, EAST, SOUTH and WEST.

    The Direction enums contain abstract methods that involve direction, such as breaking a wall in a certain direction. Abstract methods in Direction are overloaded to work with both x and y int locations and GeomPoint2D locations.

    Since:
    v0.1, 2018-11-14
    Author:
    Alex Kalinins

      • makeExit

        public abstract GeomPoint2D<java.lang.Integer> makeExit(int randomNumber)
        Uses the randomNumber in the argument to pick a cell on the wall of a cardinal direction, break that wall and return the new exit point.

        Used to make the entry and exit of the maze.

        Parameters:
        randomNumber - random number to pick the exit point
        Returns:
        point of the location of the exit/entry.

      • move

        public abstract GeomPoint2D<java.lang.Integer> move(int x,
                                                    int y)
        Breaks a wall of a specified wall and the corresponding wall of the adjacent cell. Also marks the adjacent cell side as visited
        Parameters:
        x - x-location of the current cell
        y - y-location of the current cell
        Returns:
        point of the current cell after move
